summary.para: Specifies the interpolation mode to be used when a bitmap is composed with any transform where the pixels in the bitmap don't line up exactly one-to-one with pixels on screen.

remarks.para: The default interpolation mode for a visual is DCOMPOSITION_BITMAP_INTERPOLATION_MODE_INHERIT. If all visuals in a visual tree specify this mode, the default for all visuals is nearest neighbor sampling, which is the fastest mode.
A single visual can have any combination of visual properties. However, if a visual has the following combination of properties, the borders of the visual will default to .
If you want a visual to be drawn with antialiasing, use DCOMPOSITION_BITMAP_INTERPOLATION_MODE_LINEAR for the content of the visual, and for the edges.

summary.para: Bitmaps are interpolated by using nearest-neighbor sampling.
Bitmaps are interpolated by using linear sampling.
Bitmaps are interpolated according to the mode established by the parent visual.
